bibl.title: In Search of Cleopatra's Temple.
bibl.note: University of Cambridge and Egypt Exploration Society Alexandria Project, 2004. - Two colossal statue fragments, Antony as Osiris and Cleopatra as Isis, found in Alexandria (now respectively in the Graeco-Roman Museum, Alexandria, and the Royal Museum of Mariemont, Belgium), may be from one of the city's largest temples. Possible localisation of the site and perspectives of excavations.
bibl.seg: ASHTON Sally-Ann, In Search of Cleopatra's Temple.

University of Cambridge and Egypt Exploration Society Alexandria Project, 2004. - Two colossal statue fragments, Antony as Osiris and Cleopatra as Isis, found in Alexandria (now respectively in the Graeco-Roman Museum, Alexandria, and the Royal Museum of Mariemont, Belgium), may be from one of the city's largest temples. Possible localisation of the site and perspectives of excavations.
